title: unesco_heritage_Amphitheatre_of_El_Jem
text:
Name: Amphitheatre of El Jem. short_description:

The impressive ruins of the largest colosseum in North Africa, a huge amphitheatre which could hold up to 35,000 spectators, are found in the small village of El Jem. This 3rd-century monument illustrates the grandeur and extent of Imperial Rome.

. date_inscribed: 1979. danger: 0. date_end: . longitude: 10.70694. latitude: 35.29639. area_hectares: 1.37. category_long: Cultural. category_short: C. Country name: Tunisia. Region: Arab States. iso_code: tn. transboundary: 0. rev_bis: Bis.
